# Installation

<p align="center"><p align="center"><img src = "res/home.png" width = 1200></p>

## Windows

- It's recommanded to install GRID under Anaconda envirnoemnt, download it [here](https://www.anaconda.com/distribution/)0
<p align="center"><p align="center"><img src = "res/Anaconda_python3.png" width = 500></p>

- Open the downloaded installer.
<p align="center"><p align="center"><img src = "res/Anaconda_installation.png" width = 500></p>

- Open Anaconda Prompt
<p align="center"><p align="center"><img src = "res/Anaconda_Prompt.png" width = 500></p>

- In the prompt, run the following command to install Rasterio, which is required by GRID.
```
conda config --add channels conda-forge
conda install rasterio
```

- Use [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/) to install GRID
```
pip install photo_grid
```

- Run GRID in Anaconda Prompt:
```
python -m grid
```

## OS X

- Install [Python 3](https://www.python.org/downloads/) and [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/) before installing GRID

- Use [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/) to install GRID
```
pip install photo_grid
```

- Run GRID in Terminal:
```
python -m grid
```
